entry.title: BlockFi Clears FTX-Related Claims, Readies For Final Creditor Distributions
entry.summary:
Crypto lending company BlockFi, which filed for bankruptcy in 2022 following the collapse of crypto exchange FTX, announced on Monday the successful sale of its FTX claims. This marks another step towards completing BlockFi‚Äôs bankruptcy process, allowing for the final distribution of funds to creditors.¬†
According to Monday‚Äôs announcement, the sale of FTX claims was completed at a ‚Äúsubstantial‚Äù premium to their face value, which the plan administrator said is intended to ensure a ‚Äúnear-term‚Äù final distribution of 100% to all allowed customers and general unsecured creditors.

entry.title: Will The Bitcoin Price Close Out July In Green Or Red? Historical Data Gives Direction
entry.summary:
So far in July, the Bitcoin price has shown positive movement, emerging from the bearish trend of June and rising to new monthly highs. While this increase has been encouraging, it still leaves doubt in the hearts of investors, as the BTC price remains below $70,000. With the month drawing close to a rapid end, the question remains if the Bitcoin price will finish out this month in the green or if it will succumb to the bears once again.
How Bitcoin Price Has Performed Historically
Historical data can often be useful for investors when it comes to volatile assets such as Bitcoin, as it could provide insight into where the price is headed next. For one, the BTC price has repeated the same trends, one of those being the four-year cycle of the bull markets.
On the shorter timeframe, loo‚Ä¶

entry.title: India Government Ignores Crypto: No Mention in Union Budget 2024-25
entry.summary:
The release of India‚Äôs Union Budget for 2024-25 has left a significant portion of the country‚Äôs population pondering its implications, particularly the cryptocurrency community, which finds itself at a standstill.
On July 23, the budget brought up by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman left the digital currency industry unaddressed even after prior speculations and anticipation of potential regulatory clarifications or supportive measures.
This omission comes at a time when the global digital currency industry is seeing various levels of adoption and regulation, highlighting a stark contrast in India‚Äôs approach to handling these digital assets.
2022 Tax Status Quo Continues: Community Reactions
The budget outlined nine priorities for economic growth, such as agriculture and emplo‚Ä¶

entry.title: Sayonara! Gate.io Announces Withdrawal From Japanese Crypto Market
entry.summary:
One of the most well-known bitcoin exchanges worldwide, Gate.io, has decided to terminate all services available in Japan. Effective July 22, this retreat signals a dramatic change in the operational scene of the exchange.
In an announcement Monday, the exchange revealed a compliance programme meant to help its Japanese clients migrate their assets to platforms in accordance with local laws.
The company said it aims to follow financial rules wherever it conducts business. Gate.io added that it regrets to notify its customers that it will be ending its services for Japan.
Gate.io: Navigating Regulatory Waters
Gate.io‚Äôs leaving Japan draws attention to the difficulties crypto exchanges have negotiating convoluted legal landscapes. Mostly under control by the Financial Services‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Miner Capitulation Almost Over: What It Means For Price
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows the Bitcoin mining revenue has neared its yearly average, a sign that capitulation could be coming to a close for miners.
Bitcoin Miner Revenue Is Now Close To Its 365-Day SMA
In a new post on X, analyst James Van Straten has discussed about how the situation of the BTC miners is looking like right now. There are different ways to gauge the condition of the miners, with a popular one being the hashrate, which is a measure of the total computing power connected to the Bitcoin network.
Here, though, the analyst has made use of the daily total revenue of these chain validators. There are two parts to miner revenue: block subsidy and transaction fees.
The first of these refers to the BTC rewards that miners receive as compensation for solving blocks on the network‚Ä¶

entry.summary: Trump response optimism takes BTC to $63K. Bitcoin whales accumulate most since April 2023. Trump still set to talk at Bitcoin Nashville. ETH ETF approval this week: Geraci. entry.title: Zoltan Istvan on AI and Human Immortality
entry.summary: Transhumanist Party founder Zoltan Istvan chats with Decrypt's Emerging Technology report Jason Nelson about his journey with transhumanism, running for office, and why he fears AI is outpacing life science and poses a threat to the quest for immortality.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 157 - ROLLBIT FRIDAY!
entry.summary: The German state sells $2bn+ BTC and has under $300m left. BTC ETF sees $800M of inflows, Mr 100 keeps buying. SOL ETF deadline set for 2025, election could be key. SOL stablecoin TVL soars on Tether & PYUSD growth. Firedancer sees the first accepted block on SOL testnet. ETH ETFs finally expected next week. Monthly active crypto addresses top 100m. Trump to speak at Bitcoin Nashville conference. Golman Sachs to launch 3 tokenization projects. Short squeeze in altcoins sees TIA rise 80% from lows. MOG leads top memes coins, BONK flips WIF. Farming interest shifts to Berachain & Monad.

entry.title: What's the Meta? Meet the Solana Dev Who Suffered Third Degree Burns to Pump a Token
entry.summary:
Meet Mikol: the Dare dev that doused himself in isopropyl alcohol and had fireworks shot at him. He instantly went up in flames and was rushed to hospital, where it became apparent he suffered third degree burns.
In this episode, Mikol reflects on the biggest night of his life, details his injuries, and the grueling recovery process he‚Äôs still in. Despite the traumatic incident, Mikol isn‚Äôt done with the project. Instead, he‚Äôs planning to build a decentralized app where community members can take on dares in exchange for DARE tokens.

Goldman Sachs to launch 3 tokenisation projects. Realised losses similar to COVID period. Staked ETH nears ATH. CEX stablecoin volume hits 7-month low. CFTC says 70-80% of crypto not securities.
